intro: Senecio limonius, commonly known as the yellow oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of darker yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Senecio limonius is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant and cheerful appearance.
